pageContext.description:
An incomplete Middle Bronze Age possible spearhead, dating 1500-1150BC. The object is in incredibly poor condition and thus undiagnostic. It appears to have a central ridge, widening towards the lower end of the object, though no trace of a socket is visible. The original shape of the object is uncertain due to corrosion and damage.



Peter Reavil (Finds Liaison Officer, Herefordshire & Shropshire) suggests the object may be a spearhead or a rapier blade, though based on the section of the object it is more likely to be a spearhead. In either case it would likely date from 1500 to 1150 BC.



Dimensions: length: 26.05 mm; width: 15.48 mm; thickness: 6.62 mm; weight: 13.83g.
